00025 /*! \file psht.h
00026  *  Interface for the spherical transform library.
00027  *
00028  *  Copyright (C) 2006-2010 Max-Planck-Society
00029  *  \author Martin Reinecke
00030  */
00031 
00032 #ifndef PLANCK_PSHT_H
00033 #define PLANCK_PSHT_H
00034 
00035 #include <stddef.h>
00036 #include "sse_utils.h"
00037 
00038 #ifdef __cplusplus
00039 extern "C" {
00040 #endif
00041 
00042 /*! PSHT type for storing single-precision complex values */
00043 typedef struct
00044   {
00045   float re,im;
00046   } pshts_cmplx;
00047 
00048 /*! PSHT type for storing double-precision complex values */
00049 typedef struct
00050   {
00051   double re,im;
00052   } pshtd_cmplx;
00053 
00054 extern const pshts_cmplx pshts_cmplx_null;
00055 extern const pshtd_cmplx pshtd_cmplx_null;
00056 
00057 /*! Helper type containing information about a single ring.
00058     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00059 typedef struct
00060   {
00061   double theta, phi0, weight, cth, sth;
00062   ptrdiff_t ofs;
00063   int nph, stride;
00064   } psht_ringinfo;
00065 
00066 /*! Helper type containing information about a pair of rings with colatitudes
00067     symmetric around the equator.
00068     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00069 typedef struct
00070   {
00071   psht_ringinfo r1,r2;
00072   } psht_ringpair;
00073 
00074 /*! Enumeration of PSHT job types.
00075     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00076 typedef enum { MAP2ALM, ALM2MAP, ALM2MAP_DERIV1 } psht_jobtype;
00077 
00078 /*! Type holding all required information about a map geometry.
00079     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00080 typedef struct
00081   {
00082   psht_ringpair *pair;
00083   int npairs;
00084   } psht_geom_info;
00085 
00086 /*! Type holding all required information about a double precision SHT.
00087     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00088 typedef struct
00089   {
00090   psht_jobtype type;
00091   int spin;
00092   int add_output;
00093   int nmaps, nalm;
00094   double *map[3];
00095   pshtd_cmplx *alm[3];
00096   pshtd_cmplx *phas1[3], *phas2[3];
00097   double *norm_l;
00098   union {
00099 #ifdef PLANCK_HAVE_SSE2
00100     v2df *v[3];
00101     v2df2 *v2[3];
00102 #else
00103     pshtd_cmplx *c[3];
00104 #endif
00105     } alm_tmp;
00106   } pshtd_job;
00107 
00108 enum { psht_maxjobs=10 };
00109 
00110 /*! Type holding a list of simultaneous double precision SHT jobs.
00111     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00112 typedef struct
00113   {
00114   pshtd_job job[psht_maxjobs];
00115   int njobs;
00116   } pshtd_joblist;
00117 
00118 /*! Type holding all required information about a single precision SHT.
00119     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00120 typedef struct
00121   {
00122   psht_jobtype type;
00123   int spin;
00124   int add_output;
00125   int nmaps, nalm;
00126   float *map[3];
00127   pshts_cmplx *alm[3];
00128   pshtd_cmplx *phas1[3], *phas2[3];
00129   double *norm_l;
00130   union {
00131 #ifdef PLANCK_HAVE_SSE2
00132     v2df *v[3];
00133     v2df2 *v2[3];
00134 #else
00135     pshtd_cmplx *c[3];
00136 #endif
00137     } alm_tmp;
00138   } pshts_job;
00139 
00140 /*! Type holding a list of simultaneous single precision SHT jobs.
00141     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00142 typedef struct
00143   {
00144   pshts_job job[psht_maxjobs];
00145   int njobs;
00146   } pshts_joblist;
00147 
00148 /*! \defgroup almgroup Helpers for calculation of a_lm indices */
00149 /*! \{ */
00150 
00151 /*! Helper type for index calculation in a_lm arrays. */
00152 typedef struct
00153   {
00154   /*! Maximum \a l index of the array */
00155   int lmax;
00156   /*! Maximum \a m index of the array */
00157   int mmax;
00158   /*! Array containing the (hypothetical) indices of the coefficient
00159       with quantum numbers 0,\a m */
00160   ptrdiff_t *mstart;
00161   /*! Stride between a_lm and a_(l+1),m */
00162   ptrdiff_t stride;
00163   } psht_alm_info;
00164 
00165 /*! Creates an Alm data structure information from the following parameters:
00166     \param lmax maximum \a l quantum number (>=0)
00167     \param mmax maximum \a m quantum number (0<= \a mmax <= \a lmax)
00168     \param stride the stride between consecutive a_lm entries
00169     \param mstart the index of the (hypothetical) coefficient with the
00170       quantum numbers 0,\a m. Must have \a mmax+1 entries.
00171     \param alm_info will hold a pointer to the newly created data structure
00172  */
00173 void psht_make_alm_info (int lmax, int mmax, int stride,
00174   const ptrdiff_t *mstart, psht_alm_info **alm_info);
00175 /*! Returns the index of the coefficient with quantum numbers \a l,\a m. */
00176 ptrdiff_t psht_alm_index (const psht_alm_info *self, int l, int m);
00177 /*! Deallocates the a_lm info object. */
00178 void psht_destroy_alm_info (psht_alm_info *info);
00179 
00180 /* \} */
00181 
00182 /*! \defgroup geominfogroup Functions for dealing with geometry information */
00183 /*! \{ */
00184 
00185 /*! Creates a geometry information from a set of ring descriptions.
00186     All arrays passed to this function must have \a nrings elements.
00187     \param nrings the number of rings in the map
00188     \param nph the number of pixels in each ring
00189     \param ofs the index of the first pixel in each ring in the map array
00190     \param stride the stride between consecutive pixels
00191     \param phi0 the azimuth (in radians) of the first pixel in each ring
00192     \param theta the colatitude (in radians) of each ring
00193     \param weight the pixel weight to be used for the ring
00194     \param geom_info will hold a pointer to the newly created data structure
00195  */
00196 void psht_make_geom_info (int nrings, const int *nph, const ptrdiff_t *ofs,
00197   const int *stride, const double *phi0, const double *theta,
00198   const double *weight, psht_geom_info **geom_info);
00199 
00200 /*! Deallocates the geometry information in \a info. */
00201 void psht_destroy_geom_info (psht_geom_info *info);
00202 
00203 /* \} */
00204 
00205 /*! \defgroup sjoblistgroup Functions for dealing with single precision job lists
00206 \note All pointers to maps or a_lm that are passed to the job-adding functions
00207 must not be de-allocated until after the last call of execute_jobs() for
00208 a particular job list! This is because PSHT does not copy the input data,
00209 but only stores the pointers to the supplied maps and a_lm.
00210  */
00211 /*! \{ */
00212 
00213 /*! Creates a new joblist object. */
00214 void pshts_make_joblist (pshts_joblist **joblist);
00215 /*! Removes all jobs in \a joblist. */
00216 void pshts_clear_joblist (pshts_joblist *joblist);
00217 /*! Deallocates the given joblist object. */
00218 void pshts_destroy_joblist (pshts_joblist *joblist);
00219 
00220 /*! Adds a new scalar alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from \a alm
00221     and writes data to \a map. If \a add_output is 0, \a map will be
00222     overwritten, else the result will be added to \a map. */
00223 void pshts_add_job_alm2map (pshts_joblist *joblist, const pshts_cmplx *alm,
00224   float *map, int add_output);
00225 /*! Adds a new scalar map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from \a map
00226     and writes data to \a alm. If \a add_output is 0, \a alm will be
00227     overwritten, else the result will be added to \a alm. */
00228 void pshts_add_job_map2alm (pshts_joblist *joblist, const float *map,
00229   pshts_cmplx *alm, int add_output);
00230 /*! Adds a new polarised alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00231     \a almT, \a almG and \a almC and writes data to \a mapT, \a mapQ and
00232     \a mapU. If \a add_output is 0, the output maps will be
00233     overwritten, else the result will be added to the output maps. */
00234 void pshts_add_job_alm2map_pol (pshts_joblist *joblist,
00235   const pshts_cmplx *almT, const pshts_cmplx *almG, const pshts_cmplx *almC,
00236   float *mapT, float *mapQ, float *mapU, int add_output);
00237 /*! Adds a new polarised map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00238     \a mapT, \a mapQ and \a mapU and writes data to \a almT, \a almG and
00239     \a almC. If \a add_output is 0, the output a_lm will be
00240     overwritten, else the result will be added to the output a_lm. */
00241 void pshts_add_job_map2alm_pol (pshts_joblist *joblist,
00242   const float *mapT, const float *mapQ, const float *mapU,
00243   pshts_cmplx *almT, pshts_cmplx *almG, pshts_cmplx *almC, int add_output);
00244 /*! Adds a new spin alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00245     \a alm1 and \a alm2 and writes data to \a map1 and map2.
00246     \a spin must be 1, 2, or 3. If \a add_output is 0,
00247     the output maps will be overwritten, else the result will be
00248     added to the output maps. */
00249 void pshts_add_job_alm2map_spin (pshts_joblist *joblist,
00250   const pshts_cmplx *alm1, const pshts_cmplx *alm2, float *map1, float *map2,
00251   int spin, int add_output);
00252 /*! Adds a new spin map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00253     \a map1 and \a map2 and writes data to \a alm1 and \a alm2.
00254     \a spin must be 1, 2, or 3. If \a add_output is 0,
00255     the output a_lm will be overwritten, else the result will be added
00256     to the output a_lm. */
00257 void pshts_add_job_map2alm_spin (pshts_joblist *joblist, const float *map1,
00258   const float *map2, pshts_cmplx *alm1, pshts_cmplx *alm2, int spin,
00259   int add_output);
00260 /*! Adds a new job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00261     \a alm and writes maps of the first derivatives to \a mapdtheta and
00262     \a mapdphi, respectively. If \a add_output is 0,
00263     the output maps will be overwritten, else the result will be added
00264     to the output maps. */
00265 void pshts_add_job_alm2map_deriv1 (pshts_joblist *joblist,
00266   const pshts_cmplx *alm, float *mapdtheta, float *mapdphi, int add_output);
00267 
00268 /*! Executes the jobs in \a joblist, using \a geom_info as map geometry
00269     and \a alm_info as structure of the a_lm coefficients.
00270     \note The map geometry and the a_lm structure have to be supplied to this
00271     function only, since this information is not needed by PSHT anywhere else.
00272     However, it is the user's responsibility to ensure that the input arrays
00273     (specified by calls to the job-adding functions) are consistent with the
00274     specified geometry and a_lm structure, and that the output arrays are
00275     large enough to hold the produced results.
00276  */
00277 void pshts_execute_jobs (pshts_joblist *joblist,
00278   const psht_geom_info *geom_info, const psht_alm_info *alm_info);
00279 
00280 /* \} */
00281 
00282 /*! \defgroup djoblistgroup Functions for dealing with double precision job lists
00283 \note All pointers to maps or a_lm that are passed to the job-adding functions
00284 must not be de-allocated until after the last call of execute_jobs() for
00285 a particular job list! This is because PSHT does not copy the input data,
00286 but only stores the pointers to the supplied maps and a_lm.
00287 */
00288 /*! \{ */
00289 
00290 /*! Creates a new joblist object. */
00291 void pshtd_make_joblist (pshtd_joblist **joblist);
00292 /*! Removes all jobs in \a joblist. */
00293 void pshtd_clear_joblist (pshtd_joblist *joblist);
00294 /*! Deallocates the given joblist object. */
00295 void pshtd_destroy_joblist (pshtd_joblist *joblist);
00296 
00297 /*! Adds a new scalar alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from \a alm
00298     and writes data to \a map. If \a add_output is 0, \a map will be
00299     overwritten, else the result will be added to \a map. */
00300 void pshtd_add_job_alm2map (pshtd_joblist *joblist, const pshtd_cmplx *alm,
00301   double *map, int add_output);
00302 /*! Adds a new scalar map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from \a map
00303     and writes data to \a alm. If \a add_output is 0, \a alm will be
00304     overwritten, else the result will be added to \a alm. */
00305 void pshtd_add_job_map2alm (pshtd_joblist *joblist, const double *map,
00306   pshtd_cmplx *alm, int add_output);
00307 /*! Adds a new polarised alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00308     \a almT, \a almG and \a almC and writes data to \a mapT, \a mapQ and
00309     \a mapU. If \a add_output is 0, the output maps will be
00310     overwritten, else the result will be added to the output maps. */
00311 void pshtd_add_job_alm2map_pol (pshtd_joblist *joblist,
00312   const pshtd_cmplx *almT, const pshtd_cmplx *almG, const pshtd_cmplx *almC,
00313   double *mapT, double *mapQ, double *mapU, int add_output);
00314 /*! Adds a new polarised map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00315     \a mapT, \a mapQ and \a mapU and writes data to \a almT, \a almG and
00316     \a almC. If \a add_output is 0, the output a_lm will be
00317     overwritten, else the result will be added to the output a_lm. */
00318 void pshtd_add_job_map2alm_pol (pshtd_joblist *joblist,
00319   const double *mapT, const double *mapQ, const double *mapU,
00320   pshtd_cmplx *almT, pshtd_cmplx *almG, pshtd_cmplx *almC, int add_output);
00321 /*! Adds a new spin alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00322     \a alm1 and \a alm2 and writes data to \a map1 and map2.
00323     \a spin must be 1, 2, or 3. If \a add_output is 0,
00324     the output maps will be overwritten, else the result will be
00325     added to the output maps. */
00326 void pshtd_add_job_alm2map_spin (pshtd_joblist *joblist,
00327   const pshtd_cmplx *alm1, const pshtd_cmplx *alm2, double *map1, double *map2,
00328   int spin, int add_output);
00329 /*! Adds a new spin map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00330     \a map1 and \a map2 and writes data to \a alm1 and \a alm2.
00331     \a spin must be 1, 2, or 3. If \a add_output is 0,
00332     the output a_lm will be overwritten, else the result will be added
00333     to the output a_lm. */
00334 void pshtd_add_job_map2alm_spin (pshtd_joblist *joblist, const double *map1,
00335   const double *map2, pshtd_cmplx *alm1, pshtd_cmplx *alm2, int spin,
00336   int add_output);
00337 /*! Adds a new job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00338     \a alm and writes maps of the first derivatives to \a mapdtheta and
00339     \a mapdphi, respectively. If \a add_output is 0,
00340     the output maps will be overwritten, else the result will be added
00341     to the output maps. */
00342 void pshtd_add_job_alm2map_deriv1 (pshtd_joblist *joblist,
00343   const pshtd_cmplx *alm, double *mapdtheta, double *mapdphi, int add_output);
00344 
00345 /*! Executes the jobs in \a joblist, using \a geom_info as map geometry
00346     and \a alm_info as structure of the a_lm coefficients.
00347     \note The map geometry and the a_lm structure have to be supplied to this
00348     function only, since this information is not needed by PSHT anywhere else.
00349     However, it is the user's responsibility to ensure that the input arrays
00350     (specified by calls to the job-adding functions) are consistent with the
00351     specified geometry and a_lm structure, and that the output arrays are
00352     large enough to hold the produced results.
00353  */
00354 void pshtd_execute_jobs (pshtd_joblist *joblist,
00355   const psht_geom_info *geom_info, const psht_alm_info *alm_info);
